intro: Daviesia hakeoides f. robusta, commonly known as the robust Daviesia, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in late winter to early spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and dryland gardens. This form is noted for its greater size and more robust growth compared to the typical species.
